page.title: 05FORD FARM
page.content: {Ford Farm}is owned by{Mr and Mrs {Helme and their two sons.}The farm house is about 250 years old, but parts of it are much older. The farm is{180 acres,}mainly used for raising{sheep,}though some acreage is{arable}growing{cereals and oil seed {rape.}In June l985 there were{180 {ewes and 4 rams. 60 lambs}remained to be sold as{fat lambs at Â£30-40 each. The family owns 2 other farms; {Wharton Court and Stone Farm,}all 3 totalling{530 acres.}Up to{15 years {ago}these farms were mainly{grassland with{sheep and Hereford cattle.}Some cereals were grown together with{hops {and cider apples. 10 men}were employed and a host of{part-time workers. {Today}the cropping is:{Winter Wheat 275 acres,{Winter Barley}30,{Winter {Oats}45,{Oilseed Rape}55,{Triticale 10,{Potatoes}35,{Grass}65,{Woodland}15
